This is an adaptation of a book I really enjoyed reading. Please note that this game is more of a narrative, rather than a point-and-click adventure with choices. In this game you live its story.

If you've read the book: this game complements it nicely.

If you haven't read the book: this is an interesting story to be played through.

It also works on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010459360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1445546320}
review:
I‚Äôve not read the book on which this game/visual novel is based, however being a huge Alfred Hitchcock fan I have seen the 1935 film called The 39 Steps (obviously also based on the book). I wrongly thought that was enough to make me completely familiar with the story that inspired the creation of James Bond. I was very surprised when I played this and realized how vastly different it was from the film. I‚Äôll give some examples. In the film, Richard Hannay is Canadian. In this game, he‚Äôs a Scot. In the film, the agent he encounters at the start of the story is a mysterious lady. In this game, he meets a male American spy. In the film, he eventually encounters a love interest. In this game, he does not. Also, the entire enemy plot in the movie is different. Upon doing some research, I learned that the movie took many liberties with the story (possibly to make it more entertaining for movie audiences at the time). This game is supposedly more, if not completely faithful, to the book. 
However you should know that while this story is of historical note, it was only innovative because of the era in which it came out. It‚Äôs hardly a masterpiece. It is just a simple man-on-the-run story, in which the hero lucks his way through numerous tricky situations and eventually defeats the rather cliche villains at the end of it. There are also some ridiculous coincidences that you‚Äôll just have to suspend disbelief to accept. Then it ends somewhat abruptly. I could see why Hitchcock made certain changes for his movie.
Still, despite it‚Äôs flaws, it is rather enjoyable. The character of Richard Hannay is extremely likable and his voice actor in this game is spot on. The Story Mechanics present scenes with beautiful art and offer enough variety in their storytelling to keep the player engaged. This is a great way to experience John Buchan‚Äôs novel. I personally got it during a weekly Steam sale at 90% off, so it was almost free. If you‚Äôre thinking about getting it, I recommend that you wait for it to go on sale as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119808516', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1450498530}
review:
This is a refined VN from England, whose original novel was published in 1915. 

It has a fine detailed graphic and effective text showing method that will certainly immerse us into the atmosphere. I could image the living of people a decade ago and the conspiracy towards the first World War vividly. The voice acting and sound effect are also great. Although I had some difficulty reading the strict English and Scottish dialect for I don't speak English as my native language, this game made me finish itself and it was fun.

review:
Best narrative, story driven, point & click adventure game ever, period.

A chapter a day keeps the player away. Preferred playstyle for games like these. Keeps it refreshing when you return to it.  

The cast of voice over characters are beautifully executed.

Narrative + Artistic work + soundtrack = 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041153724', 'num_games_owned': 2807, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1451473751}
review: There are not many video games that follow the plot of a classic novel (leaving aside Sherlock Holmes) and even fewer from this period of the early to mid 20th Century. This rendering of John Buchan's simple soldier turned First World War hero and post-war clandestine government agent allows for some sumptuous hand-painting of Edwardian splendour and grandeur. It's a well realized puzzle and hidden object solver and I wish there were a few more imaginations of similar writings such as the novels of Dorothy L. Sayer. Sadly, this is a crowded market and I don't imagine that sales made it likely that follow-up Hannay stories set during and after the Warwould appear, more's the pity

author: {'steamid': '76561197969301810', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1444231236}
review:
The title of this interactive story can be read as a subtle allusion to its gameplay - it is one of the most lineair and simple games I have ever played. Its gameplay is never much more complicated than turning the pages of a book.

Yet, there is something wonderfully charming about it all. 
Richard Hannay, our protagonist, can easily be identified with, and the sketched characters he meets along his fortnightly enterprise are lifelike and intrigueing. Sound and vision have an imaginative minimalistic approach to them; voice-overs are of high standard overall, and the digital paintings, though lacking in places, are atmospheric and convincing. 

The downsides are that at several moments the game didn't seem to register my input to continue, which is something that might be worked out with a future patch, and that the replay value of this already very short game is almost non-existent.

Verdict: [b]The 39 Steps is an uncomplicated, but innovative and engrossing interactive novel.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198123194054', 'num_games_owned': 2839, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1450261563}
review:
8/10

PROS:
-Great background score and event specific sound
-Immersive hand drawn scene sketches
-Great combination of reading and voice acted scenes
-Quite a great adaptation from original novel, covering great many details
-A nice fleshed out 4-6 hours gameplay time (If you are not trying to rush through events merely for achievements)

CONS:
-A little more of interactive elements would have been great
-Even better if some interactive choices would have led to a little different path taken
(A scene where you could write "Thank you" on a piece of paper to the landlord of the INN seemed non-consequential I was expecting it to have some impact on game)
-Gameplay seemed a little sped up and missing on details from the novel after Hannay meets Sir Walter and gets his title cleared, before that the game was going so much in depth with each emotion he goes through and describing each little character in detail (like the old shephard in the train). I wish the level of immersion was continued after the point he meets Walter.

All in all an excellent adaptation, I am really looking forward to get my hands on any other novel adaptation from this DEV.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041626313', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1443777389}
review:
Adaptation d'un roman d'espionnage du m√™me nom, The 39 Steps est une tr√®s bonne Visual Novel (ce n'est pas r√©ellement un Point & Clic, car il suffit de cliquer o√π et quand on nous le "dit", il n'y a pas de choix √† effectuer, juste √† suivre l'histoire).
Situ√© dans la Grande-Bretagne de 1914 (le tout tr√®s bien retranscrit, entre multiples r√©f√©rences √† l'actualit√© et aux personnalit√©s existantes, le cadre, les coupures de presse, les images d'archives, de petits films anim√©s parfois et m√™me jusque dans les accents parfois tr√®s appuy√©s), ce jeu b√©n√©ficie d'une tr√®s bonne mise en sc√®ne ainsi que d'une direction artistique plus qu'honorable.
De quatre √† cinq heures de jeu, c'est plut√¥t correct (un peu court peut-√™tre, mais plus long le suspens aurait sans doute perdu de sa densit√©). C'est plut√¥t donn√© si vous arrivez √† avoir ce titre en promotion (il est √† l'heure de mon √©valuation √† -90%, soit seulement 0.99‚Ç¨).
S'il faut y trouver des d√©fauts, je d√©plore le manque de musique de fond la plupart du temps, mais surtout l'absence de sous-titres FR. En effet, ce titre ne plaira clairement pas aux anglophobes, sachant que le niveau de langage est assez √©lev√©. Certains passages se font dans un √©cossais "agricole" de l'√©poque, non seulement √† l'oral mais √©galement retranscrit ainsi dans les sous-titres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1454107000}
review:
[h1]Short version: 67%[/h1]
Cross-media experiments are always risky, and this unique adaptation of ‚ÄòThe 39 Steps‚Äô is a good example to show it. There was a lot of thought and care put into it, but in the end it just didn't succeed. It‚Äôs a shame, really.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
If you didn‚Äôt know already, ‚ÄòThe 39 Steps‚Äô was originally a serialised pulp novel published in 1915. Its protagonist, an involuntary adventurer, Hannay, gets caught in a web of German conspiracy against the power structures of Europe, only to be chased through half of Scotland, eluding his pursuers only by his quick wits and a few friendly locals. It was sort of a forefather of the spy thriller genre that was so popular in the 1970s.

This adaptation tried to do something other than the numerous others by being a cross between a visual novel and an audiobook. Sadly, it fell between the two stools.
For a radio drama, it is good, and the actors are especially adept at portraying all the various British dialects, but there are so few recorded sections that you sometimes forget that these characters have voices.
For a visual novel, it is just dull. Everything is a still image background with an occasional grey silhouette. The drawings look spectacular, but their stillness completely fails to capture the supposedly fast pace of this century-old action thriller.

I wish I could give a better rating, because the amount of work put into this adaptation is more than admirable. But in the end, I must say that if you are interested in ‚ÄòThe 39 Steps‚Äô, just buy the book instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017924360', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1450657667}
review: Premetto che ho ricevuto questo gioco gratuitamente e non ho mai letto il libro di cui √® un riadattamento videoludico. Il gioco, che √® pi√π simile ad un audio libro, si comporta quasi come un punta e clicca se non fosse per il fatto che nn ci sono enigmi da risolvere. Si tratta di pura e semplice storia da seguire, e a giudicare da come lo "giocato" io, direi che svolge il suo lavoro in maniera molto buona! La storia riesce a coinvolgere tantissimo, grazie alle immagini create a mano (e alle poche sequenze animate che richiamano molto l'epoca in cui si svolge l'avventura). Il titolo scorre molto velocemente andando subito al punto. Contiene anche sequenze in dialetto scozzese e gallese che possono essere disattivate dal men√π. Consigliato sopratutto a chi ha letto il libro.

review:
[h1]Les + :[/h1]

- Les graphismes, les atworks sont magnifiques et tr√®s travaill√©s
- L'histoire, dynamique, et extr√©mement bien √©crite (apr√®s, √ßa vient d'un roman, donc....)
- La bande-son, les bruitages sont immersifs, avec un son de tr√®s bonne qualit√©
- Les voix, tr√®s soign√©s, on y retrouve les diff√©rents accent de l'√©poque (paysan, √©cossais, anglais, fran√ßais, etc...)

[h1]Les - :[/h1]

- Pas de traduction fran√ßaise, va falloir s'acrocher pour bien comprendre les nuances de certaines situations
- Pas de choix dans l'histoire, on doit juste suivre le mouvement
- Un 100 % des plus simpliste

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Une tr√®s belle histoire, c'est le but d'un jeu narratif, donc n'esp√©rez pas avoir un jeu √† la TellTales Games, c'est juste un livre, et un bon !

Je le recommande ! 

15/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198108899326', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1450211763}
review: It`s nice to see such a great adaptation since most games based on books and tv shows or movies end up failing. It`s a nice atmospheric point and click adventure with excellent storytelling and casual puzzles that actually keeps you playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061172632', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1417975977}
review:
[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[i]James Bond minus the shooting and add World War 1.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
++Great concept! Turning a book into an interactive story with backgrounds and voice acting
+Richard Hannay is a badass
+Voice acting is very good
+Backgrounds are detailed and colorful
+Story is thrilling and involves plenty of mystery
+Keeps the entire story and setting of the original book (Never read the book, but I read some reviews and summaries of it after playing this)

[h1]The Ok Stuff[/h1]
=It's not 100% like a book, you miss the aspect of reading an actual book but nonetheless get the story and atmosphere
=Written in early 20th century so it's a harder read

[h1]The Bad Stuff[/h1]
-A visual novel, not a game. That's a warning to you if you believe this is a point n' click or a puzzle game, it's stricly story

author: {'steamid': '76561198035560545', 'num_games_owned': 3961, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1451635856}
review:
Though somewhat primitive, The 39 Steps is an ok alternative to just reading a book. While more gameplay features would be nice, it tells the story just fine and does attempt to keep the reader engaged.That being said, it certainly can drag on in certain areas. Sometimes the music and visuals are just not enough to brighten up a passage.

It's not the must play game of the year, but if you are mildly interested in Buchan's The 39 Steps but don't want to read it dry, this might help a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023246857', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1466345409}
review:
I must say, The 39 Steps really impressed me. It presents the perfect blend between video games and books. The game is essentially a visual novel, but a rather special one. It's a digital adaptation of a espionage thriller, where the main character is Richard Hannay, someone who is put on the run due to certain events to which I won't spoil for you. The story is engaging, and the way it's told is creative and original. Besides the beautiful hand drawn art design, the sounds effect are splendidly united with the phrases you'll be reading throughout the main events. The progression is linear, something expected. Simple actions are executed by dragging your mouse in certain directions (such as trimming Hannay's beard, for example), and those end up adding immersion to the game. The voice acting is remarkable and the only problem I had with it was due to the not understandable scottish accents, but that was easily fixed by turning on the lyrics. Various objects can be explored and viewed from different angles, and The 39 Steps, at times, even is educative in a way that it provides information on the history at that particular time, around 1910. The achievements are easily obtainable, as they are completed by finishing event after event, which function like a chapter in a book.

[h1]Conclusion: The 39 Steps changed my perception of how this concept of digital adaptation of a book to a video game can be astonishingly enjoyable. It is rather unique amongst this genre, and I expect more of these by the same developer. Absolutely worth your money!

Screenshot: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=518883366 [/h1]

review:
The 39 Steps ist ein Point & Click Spiel welches irgendwie einen ganz eigenen Charakter hat.
Es unterscheidet sich von den meisten Spielen des Genre.
Der Grafikstil und die Darstellung der Charaktere ist manchmal recht eigenartig.

+ eigenwilliges Spielkonzept
+ gelungene Steuerung
+ Grafik in Ordnung
+ sehr gem√ºtlich

author: {'steamid': '76561198141651090', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1454528221}
review:
The 39 Steps is a digital adaptation of John Buchan's incredible book following the story of Richard Hannay, a man framed for a murder he didn't commit and his path to solve the riddle of The Thirty-Nine Steps.
The game combines literature, gaming and film concepts perfectly, providing an astonishing experience.
The gameplay is simplistic, the visuals are wonderful, the soundtrack is excellent and the story is superb.
The 39 Steps provides an amazing experience and I certainly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072540709', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1442429906}
review:
This is a really good visual novel.

Storywise this one was way better than i thought since i got it for free. The story was very interesting and exciting, it's one of the better ones that makes you want to discover more. It's told in several chapters that always ends on a high note with a cliffhanger making you want to play the next chapter.

The background art is nice and felt high quality for being a visual novel, it suceeds in telling you the mood of the scene and leaves enough to the imagination to let you see it in your way.

Atmosphere is the best in any visual novel i've played, the background music is very well made and the background sounds like footsteps and waterdrops is something that makes it even more immersive and interesting.

This visual novel is a must play with a interesting story, good music and the best ambience sounds i've seen in a visual novel.

10/10 

Must buy if you are a fan of visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 1585, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1459690139}
review:
Ein sehr eigenartiges Point & Cklick Game. Es ist anders als viele andere Spiele des Genres.
Alleine der Aufbau des Gameplays und die Darstellung der Charaktere. 

Ich habe zwar nur bis Mitte Level 2 gespielt, habe aber festgestellt, das es ein sehr ruhiges Game ist. Man kann viel lesen und paar Dinge bzw. leider wenige Sachen anklicken.

+ einfache Steuerung
+ Grafik ist teilweise gut, aber auch etwas ung√ºnstig gew√§hlt
+ Soundtrack gut
+ teilweise gute und interessante Interaktions M√∂glichkeiten, wie z,B eine T√ºr aufzumachen. Man klickt nicht einfach drauf und die T√ºr ist auf, sondern muss mit der Maus 4 Zeichen zeichnen wie ein gerader Strich oder Kringel.
+ einige Levels (die genaue Anzahl sieht man schon am Anfang und Dinge die man gefunden hat oder noch finden muss)

- ungew√∂hnliche Darstellungen der Charaktere
- man sieht einige R√§ume, aber man kann kaum mit ihnen interagieren 
- nur  auf Englisch verf√ºgbar
- viel "Gerede"
- f√ºr mich pers√∂nlich zu ruhig

Vielleicht ist das Gameplay nur ungewohnt f√ºr mich oder f√ºr einige anderen auch. Die Entwickler zeigen zwar interessante Aspekte, aber auch Dinge, die man besser umsetzen h√§tte k√∂nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009690713', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1441978300}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048971858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1441919846}
review:
In the 39 Steps you play a bored UK citizen who gets involved in a complicated conspiracy right before the beginning of WWI. The game will get you hooked really fast because of it's great story (it's an adaptation from an actual novel), beautifully painted scenarios and awesome voice acting. 

It's not an actual GAME, though, it's more of an experience, a new way of storytelling. There's not a lot of interaction - you just have to use your mouse every now and then to keep the story going, and that's pretty much it. However, the game manages to never get you bored by delivering the story in different ways: sometimes you get dialogues, sometimes you have to explore around a scenario, look at a newspaper, watch a small movie (I loved those!), etc. The BEAUTIFUL landscapes, accompanied by great music and sound effects will do the rest to keep you in the right mood. 

I finished the game within a weekend, and it really felt like reading a good book. Whenever I wasn't playing, I was thinking of it, wanting to get lost again in the lovely Scottish glens. I believe that videogames are the future of storytelling, and this is a brilliant example. Very much recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053692255', 'num_games_owned': 2019, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1452013096}
review:
[h1] Scottish hospitality	[/h1]

I enjoyed this game experience!
At first I was a little put off by the clunky controls (rotate mouse counterclockwise...), but this turned out to be easily mitigated.
Its an interactive novel, of sorts...
With that I mean that while its you, as a player/reader, that control the pace of the story, you have no influence over what will happen, you simply uncover the next step.
This means that game has no replayability, that is unless you have a somewhat bad memory or are very fond of the artwork in the game. Because the art work is at times very pleasing to the eye, several of them (a monoplane at sunset springs to mind) would have been nice to have had as backgrounds, but alas.
I thought the voice acting was more than decent too.

So, if you are looking for a good story, don't mind games that are good for one playthrough, and you don't demand action every minute to be entertained, I'd recommend this game. I got mine very cheaply indeed (thanks Indiegala), but its worth a few ¬£/$/‚Ç¨.

Oh, not to forget, do stay till the end of the credits :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968491625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1451686901}

For first, be ready to read a lot because this game has interactive story according to the book by. If you're not that good in english, don't buy this game. In addition to reading, you will be able to click on some locations. By clicking you can find helpful items or clues too. Nature and enviroment are fantastic. I have to mention really good music and sound effects (rain, noise of trees, birds...) which gives perfect atmosphere to the game. In this game you forget on graphic. I really enjoyed this game. It's very relaxing. I get this game for free but 9,99‚Ç¨ is a lot of i think. Anyway, good game, certainly buy at the sale.

8/10


.. and good looking achievments :D

review:
Well I got this game for free thanks for a tip, but really the game should sell for 0,99 thats the correct price for it.
And I wouldn't call it a game, but a Powerpoint Slideshow.

Now I might sound negative about this "game" but I did like "playing" it.
It contains very nice drawing and a very good and intresting storyline.

But like I said most of the time, you read the text and click for the next slide.
Thats why it should be 0,99 and no more.

I do recommend the game and it will last you about 4 hours.
Should give you an easy 100% doh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044881290', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1443494050}
review:
Me hace recordar bastante al juego Hotel Dust.
Si tiene mucho tiempo libre y con ganas de leer, este es tu juego.

Hermosas ilustraciones, gran ambientaci√≥n de sonidos y muy buenas narraciones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049786592', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1441650159}
review:
Just a few minutes ago I finished playing "The 39 Steps" and I must admit, that I loved the game.
I personally do not know neither the book nor the film by Hitchcock but I still really loved the game.

It is not a usual game as you might expect it, as it tells you the whole story of the book while giving you the possibility
of clicking on things from time to time. When I started playing the game at first I was not to sure what to think of the game but in the end I basically could not stop playing. This was mainly due to the absolutely fantastic scenario and scenery, which could almost be described as paintings.

All in all I was very pleased to have found and played this magnificent game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053144959', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1577371898}
review:
This game has grabbed me and didn't let me go even after it said "THE END" in the center of the screen. (Mainly because I somehow didn't get the last achievement which I actually completed all requirements for) 

I got this for free through a promotion, but it is actually worth the money you'd have to pay for it, because it's super addictive and really catchy. It also offers beautiful drawings and a wonderful, partially hilarious mix of a variety of British accents. I recommend this to everyone who likes mystery stories and a good novel. 

It took me about 4 hours to finish the game while reading all of the text and paying as much attention as I could to not miss a thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030080447', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1466612202}
review:
[b]Original example of how a novel can be transformed into a game[/b]

[i]The 39 Steps[/i] is a unique interactive visual novel, developed by [b]The Story Mechanics[/b] and first released on Steam in april 2013. The game is based on the novel with the same title by John Buchan, which got quite well-known thanks to its being the inspiration for Ian Flemmings [i]James Bond[/i] books. The novel tels the story of Richard Hannay, a bored-to-death gentleman who all of a sudden finds himself in the eye of an espionage storm. Buchans story has its flaws: some plot-turns come across as unbelievable, but the characters are drawn very fine indeed, as is the time period against which the plot evolves.

Buchans novel is followed very closely in the game, which does an excellent job in transferring the overall feel and atmosphere of the period and place during which the action takes place: London, Scotland and the English countryside early summer 1914, just before the outbreak of the First World War. The developers achieved this by using a brilliantly designed and executed visual style, with a lot of hand-drawn images.

Actually, the story is told in several different ways, all with their own level of interaction. The narrative part of the novel is being projected on the screen, with the player having to click through the different lines. But the game manages to introduce variety even in this simple mechanic: the tempo of the clicking varies: sometimes a screen is held onto longer, while at other times clicks has to done much faster. Dialogues are being voice-acted in a very convincing way, some self-contained stories are even being projected as short movies. There is some point-and-clicking too, although this is allways clearly indicated and not designed as a challenge or puzzle. All in all, the variety in interaction between player and game helps a lot to draw one into the story.

The awesome visuals and interesting storytelling are accompanied by a soundscape that mostly stays in the background, punctuating some important actions without drawing any attention to itself. A bit more of these, and a more convincing musical envelopment would have painted the period even better I believe. But this is only a minor quibble. More problematic are the click-and-drag actions one has to perform to unlock doors or achieve other minor tasks. These feel tucked on, and do not integrate well within the overall concept.

[b]Highly recommended to anyone interested in visual novels, in literature or in artistic games in general. It's a real shame this development studio hasn't released any more games yet.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198037920209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1205, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1661343475}
review:
[b]A good story, well told.[/b]
This is a very nicely done adaptation of John Buchan's novel. It kept me wanting more the whole way through, in much the same way any good book will. The voice work and music are both excellent and the pacing and interactive elements completely fit the style of the game. The visuals are also very good, especially the fantastic animated scenes. The game is not without a couple of slightly rough edges, though. The audio can cut out noticeably abruptly at times and the quality of the background art is occasionally lacking a little, but neither take away from a very entertaining few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109150800', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1493053677}
review:
The 39 Steps is a digital adaption of a John Buchan's espionage thriller.
And since I don't want to spoil the story for anyone still waiting to enjoy it, I won't reveal any story details.
But I will say this, the story is brilliant and has a lot of twists and turns and will keep you hooked till the end. At least that's how I've felt. 
The art in the game is absolutely gorgeous and the sound design is spot on as well. This is like reading a book, but you interact ingame with a mouse at certain situations and click objects on screen such as newspapers or items of interest. There are also times where you have to imitate real movements with a mouse ( sort of like in Fahrenheit / Indigo Prophecy if you have played that game).
There are also cards to collect and awards to unlock while playing the game, which is a nice touch for all those people like myself who enjoy collecting things.
All in all:

+ Great story
+ Beautiful art design
+ Good sound effects and acting

- If you dont like reading a lot, this game is not for you

If you are looking for a great thriller story accompanied by great art design and acting, you are going to enjoy this game. 9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083692984', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1533024607}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152369549', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1580507621}
review:
I never felt so stuck in a game before. I started it as soon as I finished installing it and then I was presented with this "rotate the mouse clockwise or anti(counter)clockwise to go further and back in the text scripts.". That just didn't work. I tried rotating clockwise, counter clockwise, doing small circles, doing huge circles, hell I even took my large mousepad out of the table and put it in a bigger part of the table to try and play this thing but it simply didn't work properly. I simply couldn't understand this mechanics, I thought myself dumb. It was only late that I realised that I didn't have to rotate, but instead, swipe. Swipe right and swipe left. That was as simple as that.
Later on I found out I could also use the arrow keys to move through the text, that also was on the controls page.

It's looking good so far, the story seems a bit boring, but I'll keep on through it. It's a good thing to ilustrate a story like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978608285', 'num_games_owned': 2462, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1561709773}
review:
Quality.

An excellent yarn that had me mastered me from the start.

It's a telling of a story with excellent visuals to stimulate your own imagination, conversations and things to do, occasionally examine things, read a news paper several times to stay up to date on world news.

Just let it happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064178377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1709499983}
review:
Not a game in any real sense but I went into it not expecting one.
Great story and the elements of voice acting, paintings and real old photographs make the story more invloved then just a simple book reading or motion comic video.

Really wish these guys would make another one of these.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002519903', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1434503033}
review:
Molto accattivante a livello grafico, suggestivo come musiche e ben interpretato dai doppiatori, putroppo ha una enorme pecca: non √® un gioco.

The 39 Steps purtroppo spreca tutte queste bellissime premesse conuna sola mossa, non far capire prima che √® un racconto (molto poco) interattivo, le uniche opzioni che si presentano nel corso del gioco sono se continuare a leggere oppure tornare al passaggio precedente, c'√® la possibilit√† di ispezionare le camere (molto poche, tipo 4) e trovare gli indizi, che purtroppo sono indicati nel loro numero totoale di volta in volta dal numero di rombi nella parte a sinistra in basso dello schermo, che si illuminano via via che scoprite gli indizi (alle volte anche solo due...).

Giudizio Finale: Se vi piacciono i racconti √® un prodotto molto consigliato, se sperate di giocare no, nel primo caso comunque occhio alle parti in SCOZZESE, non di facile comprensione anche per chi mastica molto bene l'inglese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031275806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1530911625}
review:
This is more of an interactive story than a game, and it is a very good one.  The voice acting is really good as is the art and sound design, really top notch.  The story and writing is also quite strong, I assume because it has been taken from the orginal source material.  They also used many authentic images from 1914, which I thought was a fantastic touch.

All in all, I can hearily recommend this game to anyone who wants a good story and excellent presentation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028450654', 'num_games_owned': 5780, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1451825517}
review:
Meine erste Begegnung mit dem Genre der visuellen Novellen erfolgte durch "The 39 Steps", ein Spiel, das auf John Buchans Agentenklassiker "Die neununddrei√üig Stufen" basiert, einem Werk, das von vielen als Meisterwerk betrachtet wird. Bis zu diesem Punkt war ich mir nicht sicher, was ich von einem Spiel erwarten sollte, das im Grunde ein interaktives Buch ist. Doch die Neugier hat gesiegt, und obwohl ich bis dahin noch nichts von Buchans Geschichte geh√∂rt hatte, war meine Vorfreude gro√ü.

Mein Englisch ist zwar nicht perfekt, aber das Spiel nutzt seine visuellen Elemente geschickt, um die Geschichte auch denen zug√§nglich zu machen, deren Sprachkenntnisse vielleicht nicht die besten sind. Schon nach dem ersten Kapitel war ich √ºberrascht, wie gut ich der Handlung folgen konnte und wie sehr ich wissen wollte, wie es weitergeht. Es hat mich wirklich erstaunt, dass ein Spiel, das im Wesentlichen ein Buch ist, mich so fesseln konnte.

Auch Wochen nach dem Abschluss des Spiels l√§sst mich die Geschichte nicht los, sodass ich mir sogar die Taschenbuchausgabe bestellt habe. Diese ist gl√ºcklicherweise auch auf Deutsch erh√§ltlich und auf Ankaufportalen zu einem sehr g√ºnstigen Preis zu finden. F√ºr alle, die sich f√ºr Agentengeschichten begeistern, die spannender sind als so mancher Bond-Film, kann ich "The 39 Steps" w√§rmstens empfehlen. Ich freue mich jetzt darauf, das Buch in H√§nden zu halten, und w√ºnsche allen anderen viel Vergn√ºgen beim Erkunden dieser faszinierenden Erz√§hlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016190249', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1597798347}
review: From the moment that I launched this Visual Novel I have been in love with it. I was captivated by the great voice acting and the interesting story and I found my self looking forward to every new piece of background art or optional information. Even tough I can¬¥t recomend this game enough it is something that not everyone will like. If you are like me and you think that story and theme alone can carry a "game" then yes but it without hesitation. If on the other hand you are looking for a game with actual mechanics, choices or exploration I suggest you look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064720487', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1434339231}
review:
After reading many other reviews, I had a pretty good idea of what I was getting myself into.  And I must say, despite a few minor temporary audio glitches, I greatly enjoyed this treat.  Very relaxing, engaging, immersive, and exciting.  

I haven't read the original yet, but I feel this undoubtedly did it justice.  While one is usually wary with a movie-adaptation of a novel, I am looking forward to another digital-adaptation from these guys.  The love and care clearly shows through.

As long as players are aware of what they are getting themselves into, I'd highly recommend this delightful experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049105851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1434166083}
review:
There are some game that are just the usual rubbish that just are games and nothing more. But there are the exceptions- games that push the limits of what it means to be a game. And I personally think "The 39 Steps" pushes the boundary the most, because it's hardly a game. Does it have fine points about it? Sure! It's got a great soundtrack, excellent voice actors, great background sounds, and well-done backgrounds. But I feel like how I felt with playing "Over the Void". All of this seems to be covering up how little the game actually has to offer. I played the game in roughly 3 hours because that game made me move at that pace. If I was in full control of the speed of the story, I bet I'd be done in roughly less than an hour. All the gameplay is melted down into clicking. Nothing complicated. Nothing at stake. Which really undermines the purpose of the achievements of the game. Oh, you clicked 15 times in this game! Ding!

I don't mind point-and-click games but usually if you have some control of choice over the game. And choice over a game doesn't have to mean the way the story turns out. Sometimes the choice could be how you handle a situation, what steps you take to get somewhere, what items you use on an object. And 39 Steps takes all choice away and turns the game into a tourist ride of fun places around Scotland... PowerPoint Style. But it's a well-designed PowerPoint, I'll give it that!

The story is decent. I never had read the 39 Steps, but I knew what to expect from older novels and this one's no different... the pacing is about as slow as a turtle trying to swim through maple syrup, and it doesn't help with the gameplay being slow, either. Sure, slow stories can be just as effective and the story in 39 Steps has it's moments, but there are a lot of long drags, and one particularly occurs with so much repetition you forget what's supposed to happen in the story. But the story, the good and bad parts, I feel I should give no credit to the the designers or the game's total score. I feel like it'd be better placed in a book review, since the designers just cherry-picked their favorite quotes of the story and threw the words in while an intense chase scene in occuring, undermining any slight tension the player might have been feeling.

If you want to experience the 39 Steps, or you're a connoiseur of PowerPoints, this is perfect for you. I happen to be a gamer that prefers to actually play a video game, rather than watch it with short intervals of clicking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059871439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1433777392}
review:
‚óè Worum geht's?
The 39 Steps ist eine interaktive Geschichte, die auf dem gleichnamigem Kriminalroman 'Die 39 Stufen' basiert. Kurz vor dem Ausbruch des 1. Weltkriegs entschlie√üt sich der Army Offizier Richard Hannay dazu nach London zu ziehen und wird von Tag zu Tag gelangweilter, wenn nicht sogar lethargisch. Bis eines Abend Franklin Scudder, ein Nachbar, ihm einen Besuch abstattet und ihn um Hilfe bittet. Scudder ist einer Verschw√∂rung auf die Schliche gekommen und befindet sich nun selbst in Lebensgefahr, nach einem ausf√ºhrlichen Gespr√§ch entschlie√üt sich Hannay ihm zu helfen und verstrickt sich Tag um Tag immer mehr in die verbrecherischen F√§nge.

[+]
‚óã eine interaktive Geschichte, die vollkommen eigen und anders pr√§sentiert wird
‚óã liebevoll gestaltete Settings
‚óã sehr viele detaillreiche Gespr√§che
‚óã gute Vertonung -> gute Darstellung der verschiedenen Dialekte

[-]
‚óã alle Figuren werden als Silhouetten dargestellt (mich pers√∂nlich hat es nicht angesprochen)
‚óã Belohnung f√ºr den Abschluss eines 'Kapitels' gibt es, hat aber nichts mit Eigenverschulden zutun, da die Storyline so linear ist, h√§tte man den Erfolg so oder so bekommen - man bekam nicht wirklich das gef√ºhl etwas geschafft zu haben und hatte damit kein Erfolgserlebnis.
‚óã sehr linear - l√§sst keine Entscheidungsfreiheit zu.
‚óã mehr interaktives H√∂rbuch/Geschichte, als ein tats√§chliches Spiel.

‚óè Mein Fazit:
Ein gutes aber vorallem erz√§hlendes Point and Click-Adventure. 
Das Spiel ist bisher nur auf Englisch erh√§ltlich, aber die Stimmen und der Art-Style des Games, haben es mir leicht gemacht mich dennoch √ºberzeugt.
Wobei sich eben alles um die Story dreht und weniger um eigene Handlung im Spiel. 
Es ist ein ungew√∂hnliches Spiel, ein Kauf lohnt sich aber trotzdem!

[6/10] Punkte bekommt es von mir~

author: {'steamid': '76561198092184035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1433216178}
review:
Heartfelt and captivating story. Confusing to operate the game at first, but after 20 minutes it becomes super easy. It's a story based novel game, so it isn't like a Call of Duty or Halo, but rather you get to sit back with passive clicking and take in a story. I greatly enjoyed and plan to play it again a time or two. I got it on sale 90%, but I'd say it's worth the $10. As far as achievements? Some of the easiest to get. To get a perfect game you'd only have to play for 4.5 hours, that's not rushing and actually taking my time to enjoy the game and going back to replay a few levels. 

First time playing a game like this. 9.5/10. You've set the bar high for other games, I'm afraid I'm only going to experience disappointment searching for more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123916740', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1577246232}
review:
One of the better Mystery/Point and Click games out on the market. The game IS based on a book which I have never read. So, going off just the gameplay, it was great. I experienced no errors or glitches.

For point and clicks, it was lacking a bit. It played much more like an interactive novel than a point and click game. The majority of the puzzles were drawing the right pattern sequence (up, down, clockwise, counterclockwise, right, left). Even beyond those puzzles were "make sure you click all the items", which ended up being unnecessarily highlighted for you. Which you could technically skip. What I would like is a skip for the narrative and scenary parts.

Not much of a replay value, but for a point and click/interactive story, it was fun and a must for anyone who likes spies and games that lean more towards a story than gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030293265', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1425734171}
review:
The 39 Steps is an interesting foray into translating books directly into the medium of video games. However, it fails to offer any real gameplay. Even its puzzles are minimalistic and offer next to nothing. So it's basically just dialogue and narration, with some admittedly well-made visuals and audio instead of descriptions in most cases.

It doesn't exactly help that you have to make circular motions with your mouse to progress the text, a command that can be unresponsive at times. And when the most simple command your game offers can be unresponsive...

author: {'steamid': '76561198116423732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1511411310}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080226201', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1450907626}
review:
I wanted to start playing all of my Steam games, so I began with this.
Althought the novel's genre is not my type, after playing the first two chapters I kept thinking about the game through the day, and ended up playing the rest of it in one go. Wonderful art and voice acting, and the story itself is told interestingly. Would definitely recommend it to anyone, even if they think they don't have the patience to read so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082394081', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1697992203}
review:
A visual retelling of John Buchan's novel "The 39 Steps" ticks all the boxes if you are looking for something that has great voice acting, keen artistic visuals and a great little espionage story. There's not much here to do as a player, and you could very well finish it over a weekend pick-up/put-down instead of watching Dr. Who or History Channel repeats. 

The addition of  authentic archived newspapers was a real bright spot for me. Certain parts were highlighted as relevant for flavour and the story, but equally interesting (if not amusing at times) are some of the ads for health tonics, men's moustache grooming products and the like.

The soundtrack and ambiance creates just the right atmosphere as you step in the shoes of Hannay in a grand tale of pre-WWI espionage. Incidentally, parts of the OST are available for free via a link in the game forum here on Steam.

A note for Mac players: The achievements currently unlock in-game only, and don't appear in your Steam profile (should that be a deal-breaker for you)

Also pssst....stick through the end credits for a little easter egg.

EDIT: (29/12/2015) Achievements still do not work on Mac (and Linux, though there is a work around for Linux) but there are now trading cards included in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003050487', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1490065743}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986445968', 'num_games_owned': 1208, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1490653078}
review: Aunque me esperaba algo mas de interactividad, el planteamiento de llevar una novela a este formato es bastante interesante, y en "the 39 steps" funciona bastante bien. La historia junto con los efectos de sonido, musica y arte estan muy cuidados y encajan a la perfeccion. Muy recomendado para pasar un buen rato leyendo y disfrutando le la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099395523', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1450307477}
review: I haven't played many games from the visual novel genre but I doubt that I can find one as good as The 39 Steps. It's a masterpiece that got me caught in it's story for 6 hours. The visuals and the soundtrack are really good. The story flows as if you're watching a real good movie and I've never heard a better voice acting in any other game ever. Perfection is the only word that describes this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198086331174', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1427387196}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197986654625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1487936938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137096530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1464989757}
review:
Antes de mais nada, isto n√£o deve ser chamado de JOGO.

Como a pr√≥pria descri√ß√£o de 39 steps diz, isso √© a adapta√ß√£o digital de um livro de mesmo t√≠tulo, considerado um dos precursores do g√™nero man-on-the-run, onde acompanhamos a historia de Hannay, um homem que v√™ seu mundo virar de cabe√ßa para baixo ap√≥s um vizinho pedir para entrar em sua casa tarde da noite.

Aqui, voc√™ acompanhar√° a hist√≥ria de forma linear, podendo explorar determinadas situa√ß√µes e interagir com alguns objetos e cenas, mas sem fugir da hist√≥ria do livro.

√© um conceito diferente de acompanhar um bom livro, afinal, a arte √© muito bonita, a m√∫sica √© impec√°vel, e o trabalho dos atores nos faz realmente entrar no clima de suspense.

Para quem gosta de uma boa historia, e quer experimentar algo diferente, vale a pena.

Mas se eu posso deixar uma √∫ltima recomenda√ß√£o, para coisas um tanto diferentes, sempre vale a pena assistir algum review, para depois n√£o se arrepender :)

Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006176581', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1451474517}
review: This is a great blend of a video game and an e-book. Not spoiling anything, this is a great spy thriller set right before WW1. There is limited interactivity since you are usually just clicking on various locations, finding helpful items and clues, and piecing together the mystery. The artwork is fantastic. So many times I wished I could be sucked into the game just to enjoy being in the world of England 1914. While the backgrounds are stunning, the characters are given a silhouette, letting the player draw their own conclusions to their distinct features. I love the cut scenes. They are done in a silent film style, which again draws from the time period. The cast of voice actors is spot on perfect. Now whether or not this game is worth the full retail pricetag is debatable. I bought this game for 1.49 and it was well worth it. Knowing what I know now, I would have paid full price. However, I love story above all in video games. For those who are bothered with the limited interactivity, wait for a sale. I cannot wait to see what The Story Mechanics will do next! This is an indie developer I will keep my eyes on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985833376', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1428378786}
review: This isn't a game, or even a choose your own adventure. But; it is a very tight story that I'm enjoying.  Sometimes the transitions between text are frustratingly slow, especially in the beginning when nothing has happened yet. It more than makes up for it once you get going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058552427', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1427800414}
review: I can't really say I recommend it. The game is beautiful and well made, however the story just didn't grab me at all. In the end I just wanted it to be over, and it felt like the longest 3 hours ever because of how slow it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977290213', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1427708910}
review:
Still just as chilling and gripping. Never a full face given to any character, which lets your imagination run amok. 

A fantastic adaptation of Buchan's novel, which I had eagerly devoured over Christmas, once again had me enraptured and on the edge of my seat, despite knowing how it pans out! Superb voice acting and beautiful visuals. Haunting at times, too! Worth your 99p! Even the full price! Only wish I had written this commendation sooner! It is, as previously stated a visual novel, so everything is preordained and very relaxing to "play", with none of that getting stuck on a puzzle for hours then never firing it up again. No choices to make, just sitting back and watching it unfurl. Well, I say relaxing, I was so tense and regularly had the heebie-jeebies. I bought this originally to see how it had bastardised the novel and have a laugh at it. Serves me right for being a snob!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025190622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1427658613}
review:
This adaptation of a novel was an excellent experience. I was immersed in the environment and loved the way the gameplay unfolded the story.  The gameplay is interesting where mouse movements are used to navigate the text ‚Äì swirling the mouse in a circle moves to the next paragraph of text.

The voice acting was sparse and made the moments when it was used effective. They were short breaks where you could sit back and watch the story unfold.

The gameplay was subtle and propelled the story while involving you as the main character.

My only quibble with the game was sometimes the music did not loop perfectly which took me out of the moment.  However, the next flick of the mouse brought me right back into it. 

Greatly recommended and anxiously awaiting the  next adaptation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112345904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1427873649}
review: Seit ich dieses Spiel gespielt habe mag ich dieses Spielekonzept. W√ºrde es allen empfehlen. Leider sind die Errungenschaften f√ºr MAC und Linux Benutzer nicht freischaltbar, was das ganze irgendwie schlechter macht als es ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079017859', 'num_games_owned': 1172, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1427047394}
review: I enjoyed playing through this one. Most of the time when you hear "ditigal novel" you think of the typical Japanese-style ones we're all familiar with, but this story is something different. The style is quite original. The art is excellent, the voice acting pretty good. I didn't enjoy some aspects, like the parts where you needed to make mouse gestures to continue - I felt they broke the immersion a little too much. I also didn't have any luck with the mouse controls (apparently you can advance the story by moving the mouse in circles, which seems like a clumsy way to do it considering how much text there is to advance), but fortunately you can simply press the right arrow key instead. The story itself felt a little absurd and forced at times, but that's just the style of the author, and I managed to look past it and enjoy the ride. Overall, a pleasant experience, and one I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013221862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1404586799}
review: I played this game quite some time ago and never got around to writing a review. This game isn't the quickest pace, nor filled with action; however it's a really really good story. It's like playing a good book. The strangest feeling I got from playing this game. The developers did a superb job bringing it all together and making the game come to life through ambient sounds as well as an amazing voices. The story just gets better and better as you play the game. Would recommend to anyone who wants a good story and loves to read books.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983376650', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1426699017}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040846298', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1426345011}
review:
Adapted from the 1915 John Buchan novel, The 39 Steps is a political thriller that takes place in early 1900's Europe where a bored Scot is quickly introduced to one of his neighbors who reveals an assassination attempt on a Greek head of government that will take place in less than a month. After learning of this conspirary the protagonist, Richard Hannay, ends up falling into a journey that he never imagined. 

The main thing you need to know about The 39 Steps before you go into it is that it is not a game of puzzles, collectibles or skill, it is a interactive game that tells a story and you are there for the ride. You click through Hannay's thoughts, then sit back and watch/listen to the character's dialogue as they reveal new clues and hints that keep you guessing through 20 segments that are nicely broken up. You can leave off at any of these points or just leave a bookmark if you need to leave in a hurry. Sometimes there are sections where you click around a room to look at objects and various texts, some of which are incredibly detailed and could probably take a good amount of time to read. There are never that many moments where you feel like you are in control of these "investigation" parts though, usually the only things that are interactive in the rooms are the objects that need to be clicked on, and there are is an indicator on the bottom that lets you know how many objects there are left to see in the scene or that you have already looked at. 

The fact that you are never controlling Hannay's thoughts or making important character decisions is never a problem in The 39 Steps though. The text is excellently placed and animated during certain scenes making it tense at one moment and beautiful at another. The choices made such as there never really being a full image of a human character while they are speaking to one another makes you think about who these characters are and why the developer decided to depict them that way. 

For those that are intersted in a good story in the form of a video game The 39 Steps is incredibly interesting and thrilling throughout. I would highly suggest it to anyone that enjoys visual novels, point and click games or the original book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040830056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1396457465}
review:

Lohnt sich wirklich ist aber kein klassisches Spiel. Gleicht eher einem Roman zum durchklicken. Wenn man sich auf das etwas ungew√∂hnliche Spielprinzip einl√§sst, kann man aber wirklich etwas mitnehmen. Grafikstil und Sound sind gut gemacht. Wichtig: Es ist nur auf Englisch!!! Wer Schwierigkeiten mit dem Englischen hat, sollte die Finger von diesem Spiel lassen. Nach ca. 4 Stunden ist man dann durch, Spielzeit ist also nicht so lang, vielleicht im Sale mal reinschauen. Es ist leicht alle Errungenschaften zu bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986188338', 'num_games_owned': 2368, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1452105533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028167238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1469441728}
review:
First things first: this is not a game but a digital adaptation (with some interactive elements) of the same-titled novel.

Having read the book I have to say they did well. It starts off a bit slow until you get used to the means the story is told with (e.g. newspapers you find, movies that tell parts of the story, dialogue scenes with brilliant voice acting). Once you get past that it's just as good as the book is (which has a slow start as well mind you).

If you explore everything thoroughly it'll take about 4,5 hours to finish it, well worth the money especially if you get it on sale. Be warned though, this is only available in English. For those having trouble understanding the different dialects there is an option to have it all in "standard" English - even with Gaelic subtitles if you'd like that.

Get this if you like some creative entertainment that goes beyond video games. And if you have played a bit of Team Fortress 2 I'm sure you'll burst out laughing just as I did when the French General talks about the nature of the spy.
